name: Crypsis: The Ladies Man
description:
Something I'd been wanting to try for some time now, a deck that uses Crypsis as the only real icebreaker. Here Crypsis gets his girls together for some good running times. Get him out on an omni-drive, then pimp him up with personal touch, cyber feeder. Other important ladies: Katie Jones, Sure Gamble, Femme and Kate herself.

This deck isn't an early aggro deck unless you see a fast adv coming. You can take a few turns building your Cryp rig, making annoying quick runs here and there. When you see remotes drop, use infiltration to determine whether or not to Stimhack or Katie dump and go running with Cryp. Sacrificial construct is awesome in this deck, as it can keep Cryp going for an extra ice or save him from pesky destroyers. Test run Femme when you see the need and use the appropriate tricks (keyhole, sneakdoor, sharpshooter) to keep the corp honest. No small ETR ice are going to stop you early, and late game you'll have so much cash that Cryp can just pay his way through. It's beautiful.

Also, Escher might get the 6th man award here for setting up those mid- to late-game servers just the way you want them. Entire turns dedicated to cryp counter, katie load, hardware install and draw are frequent and necessary. Timing is everything with this deck, make sure you know a turn in advance if you will be running the next turn.

This deck has been through some testing and a few versions, but seems to be playing quite well now. I may drop 1 underworld contact and 1 stimhack...that's too many dudes blocking Crypsis' game. Earlier versions had surge, scavenge, borrowed satellites...but they left me wanting. Now I rarely draw a card I'm not happy to have.

You might notice there are quite a few one- and two-of cards. Thanks to replicator and test run, you'll thin this deck out quickly and will have what you need most of the time. That is also why the deck is above 45. Against Jinteki net damage deck I won a grind out game because I had those extra six cards in my stack and could keep refilling my hand late-game.

Fun deck to play that has flexibility for some influence-high tricks. Sneak and Keyhole here, but siphons and other pests can be just as flavorful and just as dangerous.

Crypsis loves the ladies...

name: Weyland ICE Storm Big Money No Problems
description: Just a little concept, 9 Agendas (Could be playng 7 or 8, but Hostile is too good), 20 ICE and a lot of money. The main strategy is play slow, don't draw more cards, just get money. Is the runner trying to R&D lock you? Block him. Is he running HQ? Stop him. You feel you need a new remote? Set one up, you have the money, and if you don't, get more money. Looking for feedback

name: Reina Roja - Freedom Virus
description: Based on some ideas taken from this web.

name: The Girl With the Dino Tattoo 1.5
description: This deck is designed to get up and running as quickly as possible, and then to run R+D and remote servers until it wins. I use the innate ability of Chaos Theory (small deck size and extra memory) to power out a super efficient rig within the first few turns. I like using Sharpshooter to fearlessly run through early game destroyers like Rototurret and surprise Archers. The deck can either host a Garrote on Dinosaurus or bring out a Mem Chip to ensure I can have the full rig in play with no memory issues. There is 1 Net Shield in the deck since Jinteki is everywhere in my meta, and Plascrete Carapace for the Weyland players out there.

name: Fae Rush Agent 2.0
description:
MO was a huge tempo hit and MU hog so I dropped it and got daily casts.

Looking for Feedback

name: Haas-Bioroid: Expanding Infinity
description: Going for a deck that maximizes the ways to get extra clicks.

name: Anarch: Burn It To The Ground
Untrashable, Aggressive advance.
description:
Almost a direct copy of db0's amazing Untrashable v4 with some minor changes.

The focus is to make the remote with an agenda even more impossible to run because of Caprice with ASH. I swapped a single Fetal AI with a Nisei MK II to punish runners who give up running the remote and try to aggressively run R&D or HQ. Took out a Hokusai, a PAD campaign, and a Ronin to make room for Caprice since when I've played db0's deck I rarely used Ronin.

Remotes were already hard enough to run but with my change they're even harder, so when you get an agenda start aggressively advancing it. Under the best circumstances for the runner, in order for the runner to steal, he/she will need to spend a click to run a central, a click to run the remote, beat caprice, lose to ASH trace (common with so much money), take a net damage from Hokusai, run again and beat Caprice again, take another net, then steal (and maybe have money left to trash Encryption Protocoled Caprice or Hokusai or else face the same hell again.) A single loss to Caprice, which is very likely since they have a 66% to lose each time, makes it impossible to steal the agenda that turn (provided the runner has four clicks).

I really welcome comments on my first published (if not copied almost wholesale) deck!

name: Building a Better Woodcutter v0.2X
description:
First draft.

Woodcutter brings extra Net damage to Jinteki Ice.

name: Desperate Measures
description: A fast deck to either tag'n bag or score agendas behind really expensive ICEs. Panic Button or Anonymous tip to buy a lot of things fast, create a remote with curtain wall and a 3pt agenda. Early restructure really help you here. An early cleaner makes a tag and bag approach easier, while scoring a GC will help a lot your economy to create a huge wall on a remote server. Off the grid forces run on HQ slowing the runner and making PB possible while Research Station is there because you really don't want to trash too many cards. Protect your R&D with a huge barrier FAST. Keyhole is a huge issue.
